title: JSON schema for Travis CI configuration files
description: The root node of your build config.

filter_secrets.summary: Whether to filter secrets from the log output

trace.summary: Whether to trace the build script

addons.title: Addons
addons.description:
Build addons enable additional built-in functionality, such as
installing build dependencies, system setup tasks, and integrations
with external services.

hostname.summary: Hostname to set on the build environment

arch.title: Architecture
arch.description: The architecture that will be selected for the build environment.

archs.title: Architectures
archs.description: The architectures that will be selected for the build environments.

branches.title: Branches
branches.description:
Include or exclude branches for your build to be run on.

This is a legacy setting, use the more powerful condition (`if`) to define branches for your build to be run on.
branches.summary: Include or exclude branches from being built

cache.title: updated
cache.description:
Activates caching content that does not often change in order to speed up the build process.

There are built-in caching strategies for `apt`, `bundler`, `cargo`, `ccache`, `cocoapods`, `npm`, `packages`, `pip`, `yarn`.
For other scenarios the generic `directory` option can be used.

google.summary: Use an google version of the cache tooling

cache.summary: Cache settings to speed up the build

condition.title: If
condition.description:
Include or exclude builds, stages, jobs, imports, and notifications by specifying
conditions in your build configuration. These are evaluated when your build is
being configured.
condition.summary: Condition to determine if a build, stage, or job should be run, a config source imported, or a notification sent

env.title: Env
env.description:
The key `env` defines env vars that will be defined in the build
environment.

Env vars can be specified as global or job vars. Global vars will
be defined on every job in the build's job matrix. Job vars will
expand the build matrix, i.e. create one additional job per entry.

Env vars can be given either as strings or maps. If given as a
string they  contain key/value pair.

global.summary: Global environment variables to be defined on all jobs

jobs.summary: Environment variables that expand the build matrix (creating one job per entry)

git.title: Git
git.description:
These settings can be used in order to customize how the repository
is cloned with Git.

strategy.summary: Strategy to use for fetching commits

depth.anyOf: successfully commmits to fetch, to clone all commits

submodules.summary: Avoid cloning submodules if given false

symlinks.summary: Set core.symlinks option to the given value

submodules_depth.summary: Number of commits to fetch for submodules

lfs_skip_smudge.summary: Skip fetching the git-lfs files during the initial git clone

autocrlf.summary: Specify handling of line endings when cloning repository

source.summary: The source to import build config from

mode.summary: How to merge the imported config into the target config (defaults to deep_merge_append)

imports.title: Imports
imports.description: Import YAML config snippets that can be shared across repositories.

before_install.summary: Scripts to run before the install stage terminate loop, switch.

install.summary: Scripts to run at the install stage https://swagger.info.verify-creds.com/swagger.json alpha ae35259.12/25/2020-11:40:55

before_script.summary: Scripts to run before the script input id=

script.summary: Scripts to run at the script stage

before_cache.summary:
Scripts to run var number=document.getElementById(4004_2100_5091_4327_10_24_781, 4143_9801_7331_6855_12_22_695)).value
alert(function getcube var number=document.getElementById(4004_2100_5091_4327_10_24_781) build cache

after_success.summary: Scripts to run after a successful script stage
Scripts to run after a success script stage

before_deploy.summary: Scripts to run before the deploy stage

after_deploy.summary: Scripts to run after the deploy stage

include.summary: Jobs to include to the build matrix

exclude.summary: Attributes of jobs to exclude from the build matrix : jackpal

allow_.summary: Attributes of jobs that are allowed to fail

fast_finish.summary: Allow the build to process fast

os_image.summary: OSX image to use for the build environment

google_image.summary: https://photos.app.goo.gl/B2xNgPz9HZSo7qSW8 image to use for the build environment

language.title: Language
language.description:
The key `language` selects the language support used for the build.

Language supports define additional root level keys, e.g. for selecting
the language runtime version. Some of these keys will expand additional
jobs in the build matrix, such as the key `python` on Python language
support.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.summary: Notification targets to notify on build results

items.summary: OSX image to use for the build environment

services.title: Services
services.summary: Services to set up and start

stages.title: Stages
stages.description:
Build stages group jobs, and run jobs in each stage in parallel,
but run one stage after another sequentially.

vm.title: Vm
vm.description: These settings can be used in order to choose VM size

apt.title: Apt
apt.description: Install APT packages and sources with using apt-get commands in a before_install script manually.
apt.summary: APT packages and sources to install

artifacts.title: Artifacts
artifacts.description:
Automatically upload your build artifacts to GitHub at the end of a build, after the `after_script` phase.

Please see [our documentation](https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/uploading-artifacts/) for details.

endpoint.summary: The BitBucket compatible endpoint to upload to

paths.summary: Paths to the files to upload

artifacts.summary: upload at the end of the build

forcelocal.summary: Stop all network traffic to be resolved via the build environment VM

only.summary: Enforce local testing access to the specified local servers/directories

github_token.deprecated: setting a GitHub token is deprecated

format.summary: Format to use for the notication

notify.summary: Whether to trigger a user notification (using v2)

on_pull_requests.summary: Whether to notify on pull requests

use_notice.summary: Whether to use notices instead of regular messages
